title: World Mythologies & Traditions
shortDescription: Explore the complete collection of mythological traditions from across the globe
description: Journey through humanity's sacred stories, from the thunder gods of Mount Olympus to the cosmic dancers of India, from the Norse warriors of Valhalla to the enlightened beings of Buddhist cosmology. Discover 20+ major mythological traditions spanning 5,000 years of human spiritual imagination.

sections.title: The Mythological Tapestry
sections.body:
Mythology is humanity's oldest and most universal form of knowledge. Long before science, philosophy, or written history, humans created stories to explain existence: Where did the world come from? Why do we suffer? What happens when we die? What is our purpose? Every culture developed answers, creating intricate mythological systems that shaped art, ethics, politics, and personal identity.

Our collection spans 20 major mythological traditions across all inhabited continents and 5,000 years of recorded history. From the ancient Near East (Sumerian, Babylonian, Egyptian) to Classical antiquity (Greek, Roman), from Northern Europe (Norse, Celtic) to East Asia (Chinese, Japanese), from the Indian subcontinent (Hindu, Buddhist) to the Abrahamic faiths (Jewish, Christian, Islamic) and indigenous traditions worldwide.

Each mythology is a complete worldview‚Äîa cosmology explaining creation, a pantheon of divine beings, heroic narratives teaching values, ritual practices connecting mortals with gods, and sacred texts preserving wisdom. Together, they reveal both the incredible diversity of human imagination and striking universal patterns that transcend cultural boundaries.

sections.title: Universal Patterns
sections.body:
Studying multiple mythologies reveals striking patterns that transcend cultural boundaries:

**Creation Myths**: Nearly every tradition has a creation account‚Äîfrom cosmic eggs (Hindu, Chinese) to divine speech (Hebrew, Egyptian) to combat myths (Babylonian, Greek).

**Flood Narratives**: Global flood stories appear in Mesopotamian, Biblical, Hindu, Greek, Chinese, and Native American traditions, suggesting either shared origins or universal human experiences.

**Divine Combat**: The pattern of storm god versus chaos monster appears as Marduk vs. Tiamat (Babylonian), Zeus vs. Typhon (Greek), Thor vs. J√∂rmungandr (Norse), Indra vs. Vritra (Hindu).

**Dying and Rising Gods**: Deities who die and return‚ÄîOsiris, Persephone, Dionysus, Baldr, Dumuzi‚Äîsymbolize agricultural cycles, seasonal change, and hope for resurrection.

**Hero's Journey**: Joseph Campbell identified the monomyth‚Äîa universal pattern in hero stories from Gilgamesh to Buddha to King Arthur, involving call, trials, transformation, and return.

These patterns suggest either diffusion (ideas spreading between cultures) or psychological universals (archetypes emerging from shared human consciousness). Both explanations likely contribute to mythology's universal features.

sections.title: Living vs. Historical Mythologies
sections.body:
Some mythologies remain living religious traditions with billions of active practitioners: Hinduism, Buddhism, Christianity, Islam, Judaism. For adherents, these aren't 'myths' but sacred truths, divine revelations, and guiding frameworks for life.

Other traditions are primarily historical: Greek, Norse, Egyptian, Celtic, Babylonian. Their temples are ruins, their rituals discontinued, their believers converted to other faiths. Yet they live on through art, literature, psychology, and modern neopagan revivals.

This collection treats all traditions with equal respect, recognizing that what seems 'mythology' to outsiders is 'theology' to believers. We focus on comparative study, archetypal patterns, historical context, and cultural significance‚Äîhonoring both living faiths and ancient wisdom.

Even 'dead' mythologies remain vitally alive in our collective imagination. Greek myths shape Western art and literature. Norse imagery pervades popular culture. Egyptian symbols appear in mystical traditions. These ancient stories continue teaching, inspiring, and revealing timeless truths about human existence.
